thread.title: Justin Bieber Breaks Nude Photo Silence: 'I Felt Super Violated... How Can They Do This?'
thread.title_full: Justin Bieber Breaks Nude Photo Silence: 'I Felt Super Violated... How Can They Do This?'

author: Daniel Welsh
title: Justin Bieber Breaks Nude Photo Silence: 'I Felt Super Violated... How Can They Do This?'
text:
Justin Bieber Breaks Nude Photo Silence: 'I Felt Super Violated... How Can They Do This?' The Huffington Post UK | By Daniel Welsh 
Justin Bieber has admitted he felt “violated” when naked paparazzi photos of him on holiday surfaced online. READ MORE: The Biebs Has A Go At Breaking The Internet With Bare Bum Photo 
Earlier this month, several sources published fully naked and uncensored photos of Justin , while he was on holiday at a hotel in Bora Bora, where he was enjoying some downtime with his rumoured girlfriend, Jayde Pierce. 
Speaking for the first time about the nude photos, Justin admits he was initially hurt that they had made their way online. 
Justin Bieber 
"Like, I feel super violated. I feel like I can't step outside and feel like I can go outside naked. 
“You should feel comfortable in your own space… especially that far away." 
Fortunately, it seems he has since been able to see the funny side, joking: “That was shrinkage for me.” 
The nude photos caused a social media storm when they were first shared online, with some taking the opportunity to make jokes about the paparazzi shots, while others leapt to The Biebs’ defence, insisting the photos weren’t a laughing matter, but were actually “a gross invasion of privacy” . 
Justin is currently gearing up for the release of his latest album, ‘Purpose’, which goes on sale next month. 
The lead single, ‘What Do You Mean?’ has already earned the controversial Canadian star his first ever UK number one single, though time will tell whether the album can follow suit, as he’s about to enter a chart battle with fellow teen sensations, One Direction .
